ratings.comment: Dr. Wright is a nice person, but he does not explain the concepts well. A lot of the information you have to ask for help from the TAs to understand or you need to figure out yourself. The labs do not align with the lecture material at all. The homework is difficult because you can't understand the lecture. You need a good TA.

John Wright's version of CHEM 329 was a dumpster fire. Lecture was useless, lab was disjointed from the lecture, and tests and homework were sometimes just completely wrong. Was extremely unhelpful in his responses to questions on Piazza. FURTHERMORE, the grading scale was changed w/o notice and NOT in the students' favor. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.

John Wright may have been the most disorganized professor I have ever had the displeasure of taking a class with. He ended up ghosting the TAs and the students when asked about pretty much anything for the class. He was also so disorganized that he got confused by his own lectures and homeworks regularly, leading to this class becoming frustrating.

I don't even know why I kept going to every lecture. 3/4 of the time was spent on him rambling about unrelated topics or correcting his own mistakes. The labs and the project were interesting, but the lectures and homework were just utter disasters

There was a huge disconnect between lecture, lab, and homework. Out of 100 people in the class, only 30 people attended lectures because they weren't necessary. Exams had same format as homework, which wasn't taught in lecture. He's a great guy, but wasn't super helpful towards getting a good grade. Honestly feel like I learned nothing.

Lecture is confusing even for Prof Wright. He gets confused by his own examples often. Concepts "learned" in lecture have little to no application for the lab. Homework has to be coded in Python, which is not explained properly, homework problems are riddled with mistakes (homework is pretty easy once you get it though, and you grade it yourself.)

This was probably the most difficult class of the year. With that being said, the class format was a bit different, not bad, but different. HW was a huge part of the class and lectures informative, but sprinkled with errors.

We were guinea pigs for his experiment (no midterms homework most important) which was cool yet no one knew how to do tests (final exam was rough). Get Lida as your TA for all help necessary and you will do fine. Weekly hw w/confusing questions. form good study/project groups. 3 proj labs w/lab report at end of each. material fairly simple yet hard
He's really nice but messes up problems on the board a lot makes it kind of confusing however there are no exams and you grade your own homework every week
Good and clear lectures, very personable and approchable during office hours. Homework is as hard as the tests so you will be very prepared.
